qas.question: What did the 20th century see the expansion of anthropology departments into?

answers.text: majority of the world's higher educational institutions

qas.question: What was anthropology diversified into dozens of?
What type of anthropology is used to solve specific problems?
What does a forensic archaeologist become stimulated to do in the presence of buried victims?
From how many nations does the WCAA boast members from?
Where were anthropology departments found by the 2000's?
What has been combined into one anthropology field?
What type of anthropology is used to solve hypothetical problems?

context: This meagre statistic expanded in the 20th century to comprise <b5_0>anthropology departments<b5_0/> in the <a0_0>majority of the world's higher educational institutions<a0_0/>, many thousands in number. Anthropology has diversified from a few <b6_0>major <a1_0>subdivisions<b6_0/><a1_0/> to dozens more. <a2_0><b7_0>Practical<a2_0/> anthropology<b7_0/>, the use of anthropological knowledge and technique to solve specific problems, has arrived; for example, the presence of buried victims might stimulate the use of a forensic archaeologist to <a3_0>recreate <b8_0>the final scene<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Organization has reached global level. For example, the World Council of Anthropological Associations (WCAA), "a network of national, regional and international associations that aims to promote worldwide communication and cooperation in anthropology", currently contains members from <a4_0>about three dozen<a4_0/> nations.
